heading: net stocks whacked again
subheading: the net's top tier stocks headed south for the umpteenth straight day, dragging the rest of the net market along for the ride.
author: reuters
text: stocks closed lower wednesday, with the blue chips dragged down by a late selloff after soaring on news of a merger that would create the world's second-biggest chemical company, while the once high-flying internet stocks were again hammered. based on early and unofficial data, the dow jones industrial average was off 2.54 points, or 0.02 percent, at 10,674.77 after climbing more than 150 points.in the broader market, declining issues beat advances 2-to-1 on active volume of 784 million shares on the new york stock exchange.the technology-heavy nasdaq composite was down 48.03 points, or 1.86 percent, at 2,539.96, which put the index in correction terrain with a loss of more than 10 percent from its record high of 2,864.48.the big news was dow chemical co.'s plans to acquire union carbide corp. in an us$11.6 billion deal, creating the world's second-largest chemical company.union carbide, a component of the dow 30, was up 10-5/8 at 59-7/16. dow chemical fell 6-5/16 to 118-3/8.the internet stocks were again hit hard by bearish traders."it is probably the interest-rate anxiety that investors are experiencing," said jeffrey davis, chief investment strategist at state street global advisors.thestreet.com's internet sector index plunged 29.16 points, or 5.62 percent, to 489.91.some of the web's best-known names were big losers. the blue-chip internet company america online inc. fell 1-3/8 to 87-7/16, web media company yahoo was off 4-3/8 at 121, and internet auctioneer ebay slumped 8-5/8 at 75-3/4.copyright
